data.name: Row_Weights_(Array_Series_#8)
data.description: If You Complete ``` Array_Series ``` You Know By Now How To Manipulate Array Effectively , If Not You Can Take a Look To Get How Things Work : Minimize_Sum_Of_array Maximize_Product_Of_Array Array_Leaders Maximum_Gap Maximum Triplet Sum Well , It's Time To Expand Our Series For More : ## Scenario Several People are standing in a row and need to be ```divided into two teams```. The **first person** goes into **team 1** , **the second** goes into **team 2** , **the third ** goes into **team 1** again , **the fourth** into **team 2**, and so on. ## Task We are given ```an array of positive integers``` - the weights of the people. ``` Return an array of two integers, where the first element is the total weight of team 1, and the second element is the total weight of team 2 after the division is complete. ``` # Notes ``` 1- Row size is at least 1 . 2- The Row's weights will only positives . 3- Repeatition of rows' weights could occur . 4- The Vector length could be odd or even . 5- The Result will returned as a pair , as the first element represent the total weight of team 1 , and the second element is the total weight of team 2 . If any of the previous points (notes) is not clear , pay attention to the examples clarify everything . ``` ## Input , Output Examples ```cpp 1- rowWeights ({13,27,49}) return ({62,27}) Explanation :: After the division is complete,The first element {62} is the total weight of team 1, and the second element {27} is the total weight of team 2 . Note :: The Vector's length here is odd . 2- rowWeights ({50,60,70,80}) return ({120,140}) Explanation :: After the division is complete,The first element {120} is the total weight of team 1, and the second element {140} is the total weight of team 2 . Note :: The Vector's length here is even . 3- rowWeights ({80}) return ({80,0}) Explanation :: After the division is complete,The first element {80} is the total weight of team 1, and the second element {0} is the total weight of team 2 . Note :: The Second Row is Empty , So The Total Weight of Team Two is Zero . 4- rowWeights ({29,83,67,53,19,28,96}) return ({211,164}) Explanation :: After the division is complete,The first element {211} is the total weight of team 1, and the second element {164} is the total weight of team 2 . ``` If you feel Enjoyed this Kata , Then How About **Monkey With** *Numbers* in this **Series** :: Balanced Number STRNOGN - Strong Number Disarium Number Jumping Number Special Number Automorphic_Number ``` ALL Translation are Welcomed (In Any Language )``` Enjoy Learning !!! ``` Zizou ```
